name: Delta Air Lines First Class 757-300
description:

Join me as I fly with Delta Air Lines First Class on a 757-300 from Atlanta to Salt Lake City. I’m in seat 2A on the “Flying Pencil,” the world’s longest single aisle, twinjet exploring what 2020 has done to Delta Airlines First Class.

We’ll use the JebScore methodology to explore every aspect of Delta Air Lines First Class. We’ll look at lounge access (Spoiler alert…there is none), the seat, the inflight entertainment, the food, and the service all in order to answer the question: “Does it make sense to fly Delta Airlines First Class in 2020 (and beyond)…

At the risk of stating the obvious: Delta Air Lines sell more economy tickets than first class tickets. But, perhaps you’re thinking about booking First Class? In this video, I’m going to aim to help you decide whether it makes sense for you to pay to upgrade with Delta Airlines in this brave new world. After watching, let me know whether you see enough value to pay a premium. 

Delta Air Lines First Class is dramatically different today than it was this time last year. The experience has taken a downturn as Delta Airlines does its best to save money and reduce risks. 

Two Blokes Talking Rubbish a/k/a Have Passports…Can’t Travel Podcast (Ep. 4)
